item.title: How Consumers Budget
item.description: Expanding our understanding of budgeting beliefs and behaviours.

item.title: Tax Time 2019
item.description: Encouraging customers to reduce their high-interest debts at tax time.

item.title: About
item.description: Hello! I’m a third-year psychology PhD student at the University of New South Wales. My research interests lie in understanding the way that uncertainty influences people’s decisions, particularly those involving risk and long-term consequences; for example, how we make decisions around saving for retirement or fighting against climate change. While completing my PhD, I am currently working as a Behavioural Scientist at the Commonwealth Bank of Australia. My role involves a combination of research and application, aiming to take an evidence-based approach to improving Australians’ financial outcomes.

item.title: CV
item.description: Click here for a PDF copy of my most recently updated resume. Last updated: 29/10/22 Academic experience 2020-Present: PhD Candidate, University of New South Wales Research topic: Financial decision-making under uncertainty Research interests: Financial decision-making, behavioural science, cognitive psychology Supervisors: Professor Ben Newell, Professor Chris Donkin 2015-2018: Bachelor of Psychology (Honours), University of New South Wales First Class Honours High Distinction average results Honours Project: Do people care about being nudged?
